snippet: The World Health Organization is the latest United Nations agency seeking to add a new sense of urgency to the humanitarian crisis in Syria.
abstract: World Health Organization warns of outbreaks of hepatitis A and other serious health issues plaguing Syrians displaced by war, in effort to add new sense of urgency to humanitarian crisis in Syria.

byline.original: By NICK CUMMING-BRUCE and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Nick Cumming-Bruce reported from Geneva, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Hania Mourtada contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: The World Health Organization is the latest United Nations agency seeking to add a new sense of urgency to the humanitarian crisis in Syria.

headline.seo: New Problems in Syria: Hepatitis, Closed Hospitals, Ambulance Shortages
headline.main: New Problems in Syria: Hepatitis, Closed Hospitals, Ambulance Shortages

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
